name: ESTATE of Carroll E. OGDEN, an incompetent. Appeal of Basil C. CLARE, Esquire

judges: Before JONES, C. J., and EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
parties: ESTATE of Carroll E. OGDEN, an incompetent. Appeal of Basil C. CLARE, Esquire.

opinions.text:
OPINION
PER CURIAM.
Decree affirmed. Each party to bear own costs.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Howard R. Cohen, Ridley Park, for appellant.
Peter J. Rohanna, Jr., Chester, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
356 A.2d 361
ESTATE of Carroll E. OGDEN, an incompetent. Appeal of Basil C. CLARE, Esquire.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued April 1, 1976.
Decided May 12, 1976.
Howard R. Cohen, Ridley Park, for appellant.
Peter J. Rohanna, Jr., Chester, for appellee.
Before JONES, C. J., and EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
